answers.answer: I should also mention that it seems to be worse at evening/night, i don't seem to feel it after i have woken up.

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Buzzing is usually due to a pinched nerve or due to deep vein thrombosis or clots in deep veins. It can also be due to peripheral neuropathy as seen in diabetes, hypothyroidism etc. It can also be due to anxiety.Please consult your PCP for primary examination followed by proper referral.Hope this helps. Take care!
Ok thanks, i'll get round there on Monday as thats the earliest time i can.

Ok, so things have changed already. I seem to have nearly lost the pulsating feeling but get really bad shaky feeling legs and as if my muscles may be jerking about at night time. I feel "off" for loss of a better word and as i type this i have a dull headache in the frontal right side.

question: Hi, since a few days a go i've had a close to constant dull buzzing feeling in my right foot. It feels like its coming in waves every few seconds and is freaking me out a little bit as i have Anxiety problems anyway, i'm also just getting over a case of hemorrhoids but i don't think that has anything to do with it.I'm 25/male and live in the UK so it shouldnt be Lymes.
title: Buzzing Foot.
